titleStmt.title: A. B. Baird et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG4528

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p: To the Governor of the Commonwealth of Ky

The undersigned citizens of Ohio County Ky respectfully ask you to remit a fine of one hundred Dollars imposed by the Ohio Circuit Court on Jesse W Megan a worthy young man of this County for betting a pair of Boots with one Charles K Metcalf on the result of the election in Ohio County at the August election 1859 We say further that a fine for like amt was imposed on the Said Metcalf for some cause and by Executive Cemency the same was remitted we therefore ask you from the fact above and from the further fact that Mr Megan is quite a young man was entirely ignorant that he was violating any law of Ky when he made the bet and thought that he was released when Metcalf was at is was agreed that the petition which resulted in the release of Metcalf Should also have presented the case of Mr Megan and he did not know till very recently but what he was released. and further we believe that if Mr Megan is released he will not again violate the law of Ky in this particular

A B Baird P M Hartford
E. R. Murrell
J. W. Lewis
J J Harrison
R M Paterson
C J Lawton
Remus Gibson
G R Wedding
W H Miller
R S. Moseley
John P. Tracy jailor o c
John G Ruggs
Wm Hardwick
D. Miller
N P Boswell
James F. Neel
William Canon
Walker White
W J Thomas
Frank M Hevern
J B Stuart

John H Steven
Wm H Rice
Wm M Miller
F Allen
Caleb Crow
T. F. Kirby
Pardan Talior
Stephen Daniel
William. H. Potts
Thomas. W. Acton
John A. Bennett
Gabrel Acton
J M Blacklock
H H Shanks
J. H. Barnes

Ohio Cir Ct
vs
Jesse W. Megan
$100 --
Gaming
12th Jany 1864

Remit & hand to W W Miller of HR from Ohio Co
Tho E Bramlette
